definition: (standing) very straight/straight as a ramrod/bolt upright/well-ironed/trim
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]
straight/erect/to stick out (a part of the body)/to (physically) straighten up/to support/to withstand/outstanding/(coll.) quite/very/classifier for machine guns

sentences.english: The Squire presided, dignified and tall.
sentences.chinese: 尊严的治安官当主席，身材笔挺。

sentences.english: His starched white shirt has two pens in the breast pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他穿笔挺的白衬衫，胸袋有两支笔。

sentences.english: Steamed stuffed bun strabismus, he was aiming at the man.
sentences.chinese: 包子斜眼瞄瞄对方，他是个西装笔挺的男士。
日本的一种笔挺式卷轴画。

sentences.english: I flew straight ahead, across the harbor and over the sea.
sentences.chinese: 我笔挺地向前高速飞翔，超出口岸，飞临海面。

sentences.english: He was a tall upright old man.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个个头高，腰笔挺的老人。

sentences.english: He wore prim suits with neckties set primly against the collar buttons of his white shirts.
sentences.chinese: 他西装笔挺，领带打结不偏不倚对准白衬衣领头纽扣。

sentences.english: Paul sherman yale was small, spry and upright .
sentences.chinese: 保罗谢尔曼耶尔身材矮小，动作敏捷，站得笔挺。

sentences.english: For men there were sturdy gabardine, shinning silk shirts .
sentences.chinese: 给男人用的有笔挺的哔叽，发亮的丝衬衫。

sentences.english: He was all dressed up to the nines for the interview.
sentences.chinese: 他要参加面试，穿得西装笔挺。

sentences.english: I was aware only of a tall and upright figure.
sentences.chinese: 我只感到面前是一个魁伟笔挺的身影。

definition: perfectly straight/straight as a ramrod/bolt upright
variant of 氣宇軒昂|气宇轩昂[qi4 yu3 xuan1 ang2]
to have an imposing or impressive appearance/impressive appearance/straight and impressive looking
waist and back/fig. upright and still healthy
head high, chest out (idiom); to keep up one's spirits/in fine mettle (of animal)
